articles.title: U.S. Branded as World's Worst Human Rights Abuser
Koreans in U.S. Declare Struggle for International Solidarity
Chinese Delegation Feted
Withdrawal of Plan for Expansion of U.S. Military Base Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Withdrawal of Plan for Expansion of U.S. Military Base Demanded in S. Korea 
   Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Solidarity for  Repeal of Instable Labor reportedly issued a statement on May 10, demanding an immediate withdrawal of the plan for the expansion of the U.S. military base in Phyongthaek.
 The base in Phyongthaek is a core advanced base to carry out the U.S. war strategy in the Korean Peninsula and Northeast Asia, the statement said, denouncing the present "government" as the force threatening security and peace in this land.    
 It urged the authorities to totally withdraw the plan for the expansion of the U.S. military base which brings only sacrifice and sufferings to the residents in Phyongthaek and other people.

articles.title: U.S. "War on Terrorism" Violates Religious Freedom
New Auximone Developed
Japan's Reckless Military Moves Assailed
New Maize Planting Method Introduced
Temple Pagoda, Showcase of High Standard of Architecture
Pyongyang Schoolchildren's Art Troupe Leaves for Czech Republic
articles.content:
Pyongyang Schoolchildren's Art Troupe Leaves for Czech Republic
   Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang schoolchildren's art troupe led by Kil Chol Hyok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, left here by air on Tuesday to visit the Czech Republic.

articles.title: Greetings to Italian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Italian President
   Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a congratulatory message to Giorgio Napolitano on his election as president of Italy.
 In the message he wished the Italian people new progress and welfare, expressing the belief that the cooperative relations between the DPRK and Italy would favorably develop in the future, too.

articles.title: Congratulations to Foreign Minister of Poland
articles.content:
Congratulations to Foreign Minister of Poland
   Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a congratulatory message to Anna Fotyga on her appointment as foreign minister of Poland.
 Expressing the belief that the traditional relations between the two countries would continue to favorably develop in mutual interests in the future, too, the message wholeheartedly wished her success in performing her new duty.

articles.title: Nigerian Government Delegation Here
articles.content:
Nigerian Government Delegation Here
   Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- A Nigerian government delegation led by Minister of State for Water Resources Bashr I. Awotorebo arrived in Pyongyang on Tuesday.
 It was met at the airport by an official concerned and the Nigerian charge d'affaires ad interim here.    
 The DPRK government gave a reception in honor of the delegation in the evening

articles.title: Ugandan Military Delegation Here
Kim Il Chol Meets Ugandan Military Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Il Chol Meets Ugandan Military Delegation
   Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army Kim Il Chol, minister of the People's Armed Forces, met and had a friendly conversation with the Ugandan military delegation led by Aronda Nyakairima, commander of the People's Defense Forces, on Tuesday.
 On hand were Vice-Minister of the People's Armed Forces Kim Jong Gak and general officers and officers of the KPA.

articles.title: Russian Chorus Arrives Here
articles.content:
Russian Art Troupe Arrives Here
   Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- The Russian State Academic People's Chorus Named after M. E. Pyatnichki led by its Head and Manager Aleksandra Permyakova arrived here on Tuesday.
 It was greeted at the airport by Kwon Hyok Bong, vice department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and others and a staff member of the Russian embassy here.

articles.title: Taekwon-do Delegations and Players Here
articles.content:
Taekwon-Do Delegations and Players Here
   Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the south Korean Taekwon-Do Association under the International Taekwon-Do Federation (ITF) led by its Vice-Chairman Choi Gye Ho, a Taekwon-Do delegation of Koreans in the U.S. led by Grand Master of Taekwon-Do Times Magazine Woo Jin Jung, a Taekwon-Do delegation of Koreans in Canada led by Won Phyong Il, Korean Taekwon-Do players residing in Brazil and Australia and a delegation of the U.S. Taekwon-Do Association led by President Andy Mencia arrived here on Tuesday to participate in Pyongyang Taekwon-Do commemorations of the 40th anniversary of the ITF.
 They were greeted at the airport by Ryu Song Il, vice-chairman of the Korean Taekwon-Do Committee, and officials concerned.

articles.title: President of South Korean Red Cross Here
articles.content:
President of South Korean Red Cross Here
   Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- Han Wan Sang, president of the south Korean Red Cross, and his party arrived here on Tuesday.
 They were greeted at the airport by Choe Song Ik, vice-chairman of the C.C., the DPRK Red Cross Society, and others.

articles.title: Delegation of Workers' Party of Turkey Arrives Here
articles.content:
Delegation of Workers' Party of Turkey Arrives Here
   Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Workers' Party of Turkey led by Vice-Chairman of its Central Committee Mehmet Bedri Gultekin arrived here on Tuesday.
 It was greeted at the airport by Vice Department Director Pak Kyong Son and officials of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
